domain_context.title: Maritime Performance Analysis
domain_context.methodology: Removes environmental noise (wind, waves, current) to isolate physical laws of naval architecture.

parameters.definition: The vertical distance from the keel to the waterline.

domain_knowledge.physical_role: Dictates vessel displacement and Wetted Surface Area.

parameters.definition: Velocity of the vessel relative to the surrounding water.

domain_knowledge.context: Represents performance in ideal calm conditions without current interference.

parameters.definition: Actual power reaching the propeller after transmission losses.

domain_knowledge.efficiency_focus: Hydrodynamic efficiency (energy required to overcome total hull resistance).

parameters.definition: Revolutions Per Minute of the propeller.

domain_knowledge.role: The kinetic input that generates thrust to balance resistance.

correlations.rule: Power is proportional to the cube of the speed (P ∝ V^3).
correlations.physics_explanation: Water resistance increases significantly as the ship moves faster.
correlations.example_correlation: If speed doubles, power requirement increases eightfold.

correlations.rule: Power is proportional to RPM cubed (P ∝ RPM^3).
correlations.physics_explanation: Torque increases with the square of RPM, leading to a cubic power relationship.

states.requirement: Requires more Power and higher RPM to achieve the same Speed.

states.benefit: Allows higher Speed at lower Power and RPM.

rules.name: Post-Maintenance Improvement Check
rules.flag_action: Invalidate maintenance record effectiveness if false.

rules.name: Natural Fouling Progression
rules.expected_behavior: Power_Deviation trends upward (positive slope) over time.

rules.name: Unrecorded Maintenance Detection
rules.condition: Sudden drop in Power_Deviation AND No Maintenance Log

rules.name: Draft-Power Correlation
rules.expected_behavior: If Draft increases, Power must increase.

rules.name: RPM-Speed Correlation
rules.expected_behavior: Speed and RPM must show positive linear correlation.

rules.name: Isolated Speed Anomaly
rules.context_check: No corresponding change in Power or Draft

rules.name: Pattern Continuity
rules.expected_behavior: Relationships between variables must remain within statistical confidence bounds.

description: As draft increases (deeper immersion), the power required to maintain the same speed increases due to higher displacement and wetted surface area.
validation_check: If Draft increases and Speed is constant, Power must not decrease.
